page.title: 13BRIDGETOWN.
page.content: Bridgetown is a small hamlet in the parish of Werrington,situated on the River Tamer.Its name comes from the small bridge fording a stream which runs into the Tamar.There is a small Methodist Chapel,circa 1900,in use still,also 3 farms, 3 houses and a telephone kiosk.The farms are owned by the Coade Estate.South Bridgetown and Mount Shire are farmed by Mr.& Mrs. D. Lewis-dairy farming.Mr.& Mrs. A.Risdon live at Mount Shire and work for Mr. Lewis. North Bridgetown is farmed by Mr.& Mrs. Eric Rowland,who are the fifth generation.They farm beef,sheep and arable.Mirador, which is a tied cottage to North Bridgetown, is occupied by Mrs.G.Rowland. Mount Pleasant,built in 1986,is owned and occupied by Mr.& Mrs.R.A.Adams. Mr. Adams is a builder.Tamar Cottage is owned & occupied by Mrs.G.Richards.
